class.name: Animation
class.brief_description: Contains data used to animate everything in the engine.
class.description: An Animation resource contains data used to animate everything in the engine. Animations are divided into tracks, and each track must be linked to a node. The state of that node can be changed through time, by adding timed keys (signals) to the track. [html br/] Animations are just data containers, and must be added to odes such as an [AnimationPlayer] or [AnimationTreePlayer] to be played back.

method.name: add_track
method.description: Add a track to the Animation. The track type must be specified as any of the values in te TYPE_* enumeration.

method.name: remove_track
method.description: Remove a track by specifying the track index.

method.name: get_track_count
method.description: Return the amount of tracks in the animation.

method.name: track_get_type
method.description: Get the type of a track.

method.name: track_get_path
method.description: Get the path of a track. for more information on the path format, see [method track_set_path]

method.name: track_set_path
method.description: Set the path of a track. Paths must be valid scene-tree paths to a node, and must be specified starting from the parent node of the node that will reproduce the animation. Tracks that control properties or bones must append their name after the path, separated by ":". Example: "character/skeleton:ankle" or "character/mesh:transform/local:"

method.name: track_get_key_count
method.description: Return the amount of keys in a given track.

method.name: track_get_key_time
method.description: Return the time at which the key is located.

method.name: set_length
method.description: Set the total length of the animation (in seconds). Note that length is not delimited by the last key, as this one may be before or after the end to ensure correct interpolation and looping.

method.name: get_length
method.description: Return the total length of the animation (in seconds).

method.name: set_loop
method.description: Set a flag indicating that the animation must loop. This is uses for correct interpolation of animation cycles, and for hinting the player that it must restart the animation once it's over.

method.name: has_loop
method.description: Return wether the animation has the loop flag set.

constants.constant: Transform tracks are used to change node local transforms or skeleton pose bones. Transitions are Interpolated.
TODO will be changed and bleh
Value tracks set values in node properties, but only those which can be Interpolated.

class.name: AnimationPlayer
class.brief_description: Container and player of [Animaton] resources.
class.description: An animation player is used for general purpose playback of [Animation] resources. It contains a dictionary of animations (referenced by name) and custom blend times between their transitions. Additionally, animations can be played and blended in diferent channels.

method.name: add_animation
method.description: Add an animation resource to the player, which will be later referenced by the "name" argument.

method.name: remove_animation
method.description: Remove an animation from the player (by supplying the same name used to add it).

method.name: has_animation
method.description: Request wether an [Animation] name exist within the player.

method.name: get_animation
method.description: Get an [Animation] resource by requesting a name.

method.name: get_animation_list
method.description: Get the list of names of the animations stored in the player.

method.name: set_blend_time
method.description: Specify a blend time (in seconds) between two animations, referemced by their names.

method.name: get_blend_time
method.description: Get the blend time between two animations, referemced by their names.

method.name: play
method.description: Start playback of an animation (referenced by "name"). Optionally a channel can be specified.

method.name: stop
method.description: Start playback of an animation channel. (or channel 0 if none is provided).

method.name: stop_all
method.description: Stop playback on all animation channels.

method.name: is_playing
method.description: Return wether an animation chanel is playing (or channel 0 if none is provided).

method.name: get_current_animation
method.description: Return the name of the animation being played in a channel (or channel 0 if none is provided).

method.name: set_pause
method.description: Pause the playback in all animation channels.

method.name: is_paused
method.description: Return [html i]true[html /i] if all playback is paused.

method.name: set_speed
method.description: Set a speed scaling ratio in a given animation channel (or channel 0 if none is provided). Default ratio is [html i]1[html /i] (no scaling).

method.name: get_speed
method.description: Get the speed scaling ratio in a given animation channel (or channel 0 if none is provided). Default ratio is [html i]1[html /i] (no scaling).

method.name: seek
method.description: Seek the animation in an animation channel (or channel 0 if none is provided) to a specific position (in seconds).

method.name: get_pos
method.description: Return the playback position (in seconds) in an animation channel (or channel 0 if none is provided)

method.name: clear_caches
method.description: The animation player creates caches for faster access to the nodes it will animate. However, if a specific node is removed, it may not notice it, so clear_caches will force the player to search for the nodes again.

constants.constant: Maximum amount of animation channels.

class.name: BaseButton
class.brief_description: Provides a base class for different kinds of buttons.
class.description: BaseButton is the abstract base class for buttons, so it shouldn't be used directly (It doesnt display anything). Other types of buttons inherit from it.

method.name: set_pressed
method.description: Set the button to pressed state (only if toggle_mode is active).

method.name: is_pressed
method.description: Return when the button is pressed (only if toggle_mode is active).

method.name: set_toggle_mode
method.description: Set the button toggle_mode property. Toggle mode makes the button flip state between pressed and unpressed each time its area is clicked.

method.name: is_toggle_mode
method.description: Return the toggle_mode property (see [method set_toggle_mode]).

method.name: set_disabled
method.description: Set the button into disabled state. When a button is disabled, it can't be clicked or toggled.

method.name: is_disabled
method.description: Return wether the button is in disabled state (see [method set_disabled]).

method.name: set_click_on_press
method.description: Set the button click_on_press mode. This mode generates click signals when a mousebutton or key is just pressed (by default signals are generated when the button/keys are released and both press and release occur in the visual area of the Button).

method.name: get_click_on_press
method.description: Return the state of the click_on_press property (see [method set_click_on_press]).

signal.name: toggled
signal.description: This signal is emitted when the button was just toggled between pressed and normal states (only if toggle_mode is active). The new state is contained in the [html i]pressed[html /i] argument.

signal.name: pressed
signal.description: This signal is emitted every time the button is pressed or toggled.

class.name: Button
class.brief_description: Standard themed Button.
class.description: Button is just the standard themed button: [html image src="images/button_example.png"/] It can contain a text and an icon, and will display them according to the current theme.

method.name: set_text
method.description: Set the button text, which will be displayed inside the button area.

method.name: get_text
method.description: Return the button text.

method.name: set_icon
method.description: Set the button icon, which will be displayed to the left of the text.

method.name: get_icon
method.description: Return the button icon.

method.name: set_flat
method.description: Set the [html i]flat[html /i] property of a Button. Flat buttons don't display decoration unless hoevered or pressed.

method.name: set_clip_text
method.description: Set the [html i]clip_text[html /i] property of a Button. When this property is enabled, text that is too large to fit the button is clipped, when disabled (default) the Button will always be wide enough to hold the text.

method.name: get_clip_text
method.description: Return the state of the [html i]clip_text[html /i] property (see [method set_clip_text])

method.name: is_flat
method.description: Return the state of the [html i]flat[html /i] property (see [method set_flat])

class.name: Camera
class.brief_description: Camera node, displays from a point of view.
class.description: Camera is a special node that displays what is visible from its current location. Cameras register themselves in the nearest [Viewport] node (when ascending the tree). Only one camera can be active per viewport. If no viewport is available ascending the tree, the Camera will register in the global viewport. In other words, a Camera just provides [html i]3D[html /i] display capabilities to a [Viewport], and, without one, a [Scene] registered in that [Viewport] (or higher viewports) can't be displayed.

method.name: project_ray_normal
method.description: Return a normal vector in worldspace, that is the result of projecting a point on the [Viewport] rectangle by the camera proyection. This is useful for casting rays in the form of (origin,normal) for object intersection or picking.

method.name: project_ray_origin
method.description: Return a 3D position in worldspace, that is the result of projecting a point on the [Viewport] rectangle by the camera proyection. This is useful for casting rays in the form of (origin,normal) for object intersection or picking.

method.name: unproject_position
method.description: Return how a 3D point in worldpsace maps to a 2D coordinate in the [Viewport] rectangle.

method.name: set_perspective
method.description: Set the camera projection to perspective mode, by specifying a [html i]FOV[html /i] angle in degrees (FOV means Field of View), and the [html i]near[html /i] and [html i]far[html /i] clip planes in worldspace units.

method.name: set_orthogonal
method.description: Set the camera projection to orthogonal mode, by specifying a rectangle and the [html i]near[html /i] and [html i]far[html /i] clip planes in worldspace units. (As a hint, 2D games often use this projection, with values specified in pixels)

method.name: make_current
method.description: Make this camera the current Camera for the [Viewport] (see class description). If the Camera Node is outside the scene tree, it will attempt to become current once it's added.

method.name: is_current
method.description: Return wether the Camera is the current one in the [Viewport], or plans to become current (if outside the scene tree).

method.name: get_camera_transform
method.description: Get the camera transform. Subclassed cameras (such as CharacterCamera) may provide different transforms than the [Node] transform.

constants.constant: Perspective Projection (object's size on the screen becomes smaller when far away).
Orthogonal Projection (objects remain the same size on the screen no matter how far away they are).

class.name: Control
class.brief_description: Control is the base class Node for all the GUI components.
class.description: Control is the base class Node for all the GUI components. Every GUI component inherits from it, directly or indirectly. Control Nodes contain positions relative to their parent control nodes. In this way, sections of the scene tree made of contiguous Control Nodes, become user interfaces.[html br/] Controls contain a [html i]canvas item[html /i] RID from the visual server, and can draw to it when receiving a NOTIFICATION_DRAW.[html br/] TODO: Explain margins and anchors[html br/] TODO: explain focus[html br/]

method.name: get_minimum_size
method.description: Return the minimum size this Control can shrink to. A control will never be displayed or resized smaller than its minimum size.

method.name: is_window
method.description: Return wether this control is a [html i]window[html /i]. Controls are considered windows when their parent [Node] is not a Control.

method.name: get_window
method.description: Return the [html i]window[html /i] for this control, ascending the scene tree (see [method is_window]).

method.name: set_anchor
method.description: Change the anchor (ANCHOR_BEGIN, ANCHOR_END, ANCHOR_RATIO) type for a margin (MARGIN_LEFT, MARGIN_TOP, MARGIN_RIGHT, MARGIN_BOTTOM). Changing the anchor mode converts the current margin offset from the previos anchor mode to the new one, so margin offsets ([method set_margin]) must be done after setting anchors, or at the same time ([method set_anchor_and_margin]).

method.name: get_anchor
method.description: Return the anchor type (ANCHOR_BEGIN, ANCHOR_END, ANCHOR_RATIO) for a given margin (MARGIN_LEFT, MARGIN_TOP, MARGIN_RIGHT, MARGIN_BOTTOM).

method.name: set_margin
method.description: Set a margin offset. Margin can be one of (MARGIN_LEFT, MARGIN_TOP, MARGIN_RIGHT, MARGIN_BOTTOM). Offset value being set depends on the anchor mode.

method.name: set_anchor_and_margin
method.description: Change the anchor (ANCHOR_BEGIN, ANCHOR_END, ANCHOR_RATIO) type for a margin (MARGIN_LEFT, MARGIN_TOP, MARGIN_RIGHT, MARGIN_BOTTOM), and also set its offset. This is a helper (see [method set_anchor] and [method set_margin]).

method.name: set_begin
method.description: Sets MARGIN_LEFT and MARGIN_TOP at the same time. This is a helper (see [method set_margin]).

method.name: set_end
method.description: Sets MARGIN_RIGHT and MARGIN_BOTTOM at the same time. This is a helper (see [method set_margin]).

method.name: set_pos
method.description: Move the Control to a new position, relative to the top-left corner of the parent Control, changing all margins if needed and without changing current anchor mode. This is a helper (see [method set_margin]).

method.name: set_size
method.description: Changes MARGIN_RIGHT and MARGIN_BOTTOM to fit a given size. This is a helper (see [method set_margin]).

method.name: set_global_pos
method.description: Move the Control to a new position, relative to the top-left corner of the [html i]window[html /i] Control, and without changing current anchor mode. (see [method set_margin]).

method.name: get_margin
method.description: Return a margin offset. Margin can be one of (MARGIN_LEFT, MARGIN_TOP, MARGIN_RIGHT, MARGIN_BOTTOM). Offset value being returned depends on the anchor mode.

method.name: get_end
method.description: Returns MARGIN_LEFT and MARGIN_TOP at the same time. This is a helper (see [method set_margin]).

method.name: get_pos
method.description: Returns the Control position, relative to the top-left corner of the parent Control and independly of the anchor mode.

method.name: get_size
method.description: Returns the size of the Control, computed from all margins, however the size returned will [html b]never be smaller than the minimum size reported by [method get_minimum_size][html /b]. This means that even if end position of the Control rectangle is smaller than the begin position, the Control will still display and interact correctly. (see description, [method get_minimum_size], [method set_margin], [method set_anchor]).

method.name: get_global_pos
method.description: Returns the Control position, relative to the top-left corner of the parent Control and independent of the anchor mode.

method.name: get_rect
method.description: Return position and size of the Control, relative to the top-left corner of the parent Control. This is a helper (see [method get_pos],[method get_size]).

method.name: get_global_rect
method.description: Return position and size of the Control, relative to the top-left corner of the [html i]window[html /i] Control. This is a helper (see [method get_global_pos],[method get_size]).

method.name: set_area_as_parent_rect
method.description: Change all margins and anchors, so this Control always takes up the same area as the parent Control. This is a helper (see [method set_anchor],[method set_margin]).

method.name: show_modal
method.description: Display a Control as modal. Control must be a subwindow (see [method set_as_subwindow]). Modal controls capture the input signals until closed or the area outside them is accessed. When a modal control loses focus, or the ESC key is pressed, they automatically hide. Modal controls are used extensively for popup dialogs and menus.

method.name: set_focus_mode
method.description: Set the focus access mode for the control (FOCUS_NONE, FOCUS_CLICK, FOCUS_ALL). Only one Control can be focused at the same time, and it will receive keyboard signals.

method.name: has_focus
method.description: Return wether the Control is the current focused control (see [method set_focus_mode]).

method.name: grab_focus
method.description: Steal the focus from another control and become the focused control (see [method set_focus_mode]).

method.name: set_theme
method.description: Override whole the [Theme] for this Control and all its children controls.

method.name: get_theme
method.description: Return a [Theme] override, if one exists (see [method set_theme]).

method.name: add_icon_override
method.description: Override a single icon ([Texture]) in the theme of this Control. If texture is empty, override is cleared.

method.name: add_style_override
method.description: Override a single stylebox ([Stylebox]) in the theme of this Control. If stylebox is empty, override is cleared.

method.name: add_font_override
method.description: Override a single font (font) in the theme of this Control. If font is empty, override is cleared.

method.name: add_constant_override
method.description: Override a single constant (integer) in the theme of this Control. If constant equals Theme.INVALID_CONSTANT, override is cleared.

method.name: get_parent_control
method.description: Return the parent Control. Unlike get_parent() in [Node], only returns a valid object if the parent is a Control.

constants.constant: Control gained focus.
Mouse pointer entered the area of the Control.
Control changed size (get_size() reports the new size).
Control can acquire focus only if clicked.
Control lost focus.
Control can't acquire focus.
X is relative to MARGIN_LEFT, Y is relative to MARGIN_TOP,
Mouse pointer exited the area of the Control.
Control can acquire focus if clicked, or by pressing TAB/Directionals in the keyboard from another Control.
X and Y are a ratio (0 to 1) relative to the parent size 0 is left/top, 1 is right/bottom.
X is relative to -MARGIN_RIGHT, Y is relative to -MARGIN_BOTTOM,

class.name: GridMap
class.brief_description: GridMap is like a tile map, but in 3D.
class.description: GridMap is a 3D Tile map, using [html i]3D Cells[html /i] instead of tiles. On each cell, a mesh and a collision volume can be placed from a [MeshLibrary]. GridMap is used for designing worlds quickly. Despite that GridMaps can contain up to hundreds millions of cells, they are very optimized, and only use resources for the cells that contain items.

method.name: set_theme
method.description: Set a MeshLibrary. Cell indices refer to items in the theme.

method.name: get_theme
method.description: Get the current MeshLibrary (if exists).

method.name: set_cell_size
method.description: Set the size of a cell, in worldpsace units. All cells in a GridMap are the same size.

method.name: get_cell_size
method.description: Return the current cell size.

method.name: set_width
method.description: Set the width of the GridMap. Width is the amount of cells i the direction of the X coordinate.

method.name: get_width
method.description: Get the width of the GridMap. Width is the amount of cells i the direction of the X coordinate.

method.name: set_height
method.description: Set the height of the GridMap. Height is the amount of cells i the direction of the Y coordinate.

method.name: get_height
method.description: Get the height of the GridMap. Height is the amount of cells i the direction of the Y coordinate.

method.name: set_depth
method.description: Set the depth of the GridMap. Depth is the amount of cells i the direction of the Z coordinate.

method.name: get_depth
method.description: Get the depth of the GridMap. Depth is the amount of cells i the direction of the Z coordinate.

method.name: set_cell_item
method.description: Set a cell item (x,y,z pos). Cell items are indices to items in the [MeshLibrary].

method.name: get_cell_item
method.description: Get a cell item (x,y,z pos). Cell items are indices to items in the [MeshLibrary].

constants.constant: Value indicating that a cell item is not used or invalid.

class.name: MeshLibrary
class.brief_description: Theme for a [GridMap].
class.description: MeshLibrary is [Resource] containing the data used in a [GridMap]. It's filled with items, each containing a mesh and a collision shape.

method.name: create_item
method.description: Create a new item, and assign it a given id.

method.name: set_item_name
method.description: Set the name of an item, referenced by id.

method.name: set_item_mesh
method.description: Set the [Mesh] of an item, referenced by id.

method.name: get_item_name
method.description: Get the name of an item, referenced by id.

method.name: get_item_mesh
method.description: Get the [Mesh] of an item, referenced by id.

method.name: remove_item
method.description: Remove an item, referenced by id.

method.name: clear
method.description: Clear all items contained in this resource.

method.name: get_item_list
method.description: Get the list of item IDs contained in this theme.

method.name: get_last_unused_item_id
method.description: Get the last unused item id. This is useful for creating new item IDs.

class.name: DirectionalLight
class.brief_description: Directional Light, such as the Sun or the Moon.
class.description: A DirectionalLight is a type of [Light] node that emits light constantly in one direction (the negative z axis of the node). It is used lights with strong intensity that are located far away from the scene to model sunlight or moonlight. The worldpace location of the DirectionalLight transform (origin) is ignored, only the basis is used do determine light direction.

class.name: FileDialog
class.brief_description: Dialog for selecting files or directories in the filesystem.
class.description: FileDialog is a preset dialog used to choose files and directories in the filesystem. It supports filter masks.

method.name: clear_filters
method.description: Clear all the added filters in the dialog.

method.name: add_filter
method.description: Add a custom filter. Filter format is: "mask ; description.

method.name: get_current_dir
method.description: Get the current working directory of the file dialog.

method.name: get_current_file
method.description: Get the current selected file of the file dialog (empty if none).

method.name: get_current_path
method.description: Get the current selected path (directory and file) of the file dialog (empty if none).

method.name: set_mode
method.description: Set the file dialog mode from the MODE_* enum.

method.name: get_mode
method.description: Get the file dialog mode from the MODE_* enum.

signal.name: file_selected
signal.description: Event emitted when the user selects a file (double clicks it or presses the OK button).

constants.constant: Editor will not allow to select unexisting files.
Editor will warn when a file exists.

class.name: FixedMaterial
class.brief_description: Simple Material with a fixed parameter set.
class.description: FixedMaterial is a simple type of material [Resource], which contains a fixed amount of paramters. It is the only type of material supported in fixed-pipeline devices and APIs. It is also an often a better alternative to [ShaderMaterial] for most simple use cases.

method.name: set_parameter
method.description: Set a parameter, parameters are defined in the PARAM_* enum. The type of each parameter may change, so it's best to check the enum.

method.name: get_parameter
method.description: Return a parameter, parameters are defined in the PARAM_* enum. The type of each parameter may change, so it's best to check the enum.

method.name: set_texture
method.description: Set a texture. Textures change parameters per texel and are mapped to the model depending on the texcoord mode (see [method set_texcoord_mode]).

method.name: get_texture
method.description: Return a texture. Textures change parameters per texel and are mapped to the model depending on the texcoord mode (see [method set_texcoord_mode]).

method.name: set_texgen_mode
method.description: Set the texture coordinate generation mode. Materials have a unique, texgen mode which can generate texture coordinates on the fly. Texgen mode must be one of the values from the TEXGEN_* enum. TEXGEN can be selected as a texture coordinate mode (see [method set_texcoord_mode]).

method.name: get_texgen_mode
method.description: Return the texture coordinate generation mode. Materials have a unique, texgen mode which can generate texture coordinates on the fly. Texgen mode must be one of the values from the TEXGEN_* enum. TEXGEN can be selected as a texture coordinate mode (see [method set_texcoord_mode]).

method.name: set_texcoord_mode
method.description: Set the texture coordinate mode. Each texture param (from the PARAM_* enum) has one. It defines how the textures are mapped to the object.

method.name: get_texcoord_mode
method.description: Return the texture coordinate mode. Each texture param (from the PARAM_* enum) has one. It defines how the textures are mapped to the object.

method.name: set_uv_transform
method.description: Sets a special transform used to post-transform UV coordinates of the uv_xfrom tecoord mode: TEXCOORD_UV_TRANSFORM

method.name: get_uv_transform
method.description: Returns the special transform used to post-transform UV coordinates of the uv_xfrom tecoord mode: TEXCOORD_UV_TRANSFORM

constants.constant: Specular Exponent (size of the specular dot)
Detail Layer for diffuse lighting.
Read texture coordinates from the UV2 array.
Use the screen coordinates as UV, scaled by depth and the screenz coefficient.
Read texture coordinates from the UV array and transform them by uv_xform.
Use object local X and Y coordinates as UV.
Maximum amount of parameters
Diffuse Lighting (light scattered from surface).
Emission Lighting (light emitted from the surface)
Specular Lighting (light reflected from the surface).
Mix coefficient for the detail layer.
Use view normal reflected by object normal as UV.
Normal Map (irregularity map).
Glow (Visible emitted scattered light).
Read texture coordinates from the UV array.
Use texture coordinates from the texgen.
Use the screen coordinates as UV.

class.name: Font
class.brief_description: Internationalized font and text drawing support.
class.description: Font contains an unicode compatible character set, as well as the ability to draw it with variable width, ascent, descent and kerning. For creating fonts from TTF files (or other font formats), see the editor support for fonts. TODO check wikipedia for graph of ascent/baseline/descent/height/etc.

method.name: set_height
method.description: Set the total font height (ascent plus descent) in pixels.

method.name: get_height
method.description: Return the total font height (ascent plus descent) in pixels.

method.name: set_ascent
method.description: Set the font ascent (number of pixels above the baseline).

method.name: get_ascent
method.description: Return the font ascent (number of pixels above the baseline).

method.name: get_descent
method.description: Return the font descent (number of pixels below the baseline).

method.name: add_kerning_pair
method.description: Add a kerning pair to the [Font] as a difference. Kerning pairs are special cases where a typeface advance is determined by the next character.

method.name: get_kerning_pair
method.description: Return a kerning pair as a difference. Kerning pairs are special cases where a typeface advance is determined by the next character.

method.name: add_texture
method.description: Add a texture to the [Font].

method.name: add_char
method.description: Add a character to the font, where "character" is the unicode value, "texture" is the texture index, "rect" is the region in the texture (in pixels!), "align" is the (optional) alignment for the character and "advance" is the (optional) advance.

method.name: get_char_size
method.description: Return the size of a character, optionally taking kerning into account if the next character is provided.

method.name: get_string_size
method.description: Return the size of a string, taking kerning and advance into account.

method.name: clear
method.description: Clear all the font data.

method.name: draw
method.description: Draw "string" into a canvas item using the font at a given "pos" position, with "modulate" color, and optionally clipping the width. "pos" specifies te baseline, not the top. To draw from the top, [html i]ascent[html /i] must be added to the Y axis.

method.name: draw_char
method.description: Draw character "char" into a canvas item using the font at a given "pos" position, with "modulate" color, and optionally kerning if "next" is apassed. clipping the width. "pos" specifies te baseline, not the top. To draw from the top, [html i]ascent[html /i] must be added to the Y axis. The width used by the character is returned, making this function useful for drawing strings character by character.

class.name: Globals
class.brief_description: Contains global variables accessible from everywhere.
class.description: Contains global variables accessible from everywhere. Use the normal [Object] API, such as "Globals.get(variable)", "Globals.set(variable,value)" or "Globals.has(variable)" to access them. Variables stored in engine.cfg are also loaded into globals, making this object very useful for reading custom game configuration options.

class.name: HScrollBar
class.brief_description: Horizontal version of [ScrollBar], which goes from top (min) to bottom (max).

class.name: HSeparator
class.brief_description: Horizontal version of [Separator].
class.description: Horizontal version of [Separator]. It is used to separate objects vertiacally, though (but it looks horizontal!).

class.name: IP
class.brief_description: IP Protocol support functions.
class.description: IP contains some support functions for the IPv4 protocol. TCP/IP support is in different classes (see [TCP_Client], [TCP_Server]). IP provides hostname resolution support, both blocking and threaded.

method.name: resolve_hostname
method.description: Resolve a given hostname, blocking. Resolved hostname is returned as an IP.

method.name: resolve_hostname_queue_item
method.description: Create a queue item for resolving a given hostname. The queue ID is returned, or RESOLVER_INVALID_ID on error.

method.name: get_resolve_item_status
method.description: Return the status of hostname queued for resolving, given it's queue ID. Returned status can be any of the RESOLVER_STATUS_* enumeration.

method.name: get_resolve_item_address
method.description: Return a resolved item address, or an empty string if an error happened or resolution didn't happen yet (see [method get_resolve_item_status]).

method.name: erase_resolve_item
method.description: Erase a queue ID, removing it from the queue if needed. This should be used after a queue is completed to free it and enable more queries to happen.

class.name: Label
class.brief_description: Control that displays formatted text.
class.description: Label is a control that displays formatted text, optionally autowrapping it to the [Control] area. It inherits from range to be able to scroll wrapped text vertically.

method.name: set_align
method.description: Set the alignmend mode to any of the ALIGN_* enumeration values.

method.name: get_align
method.description: Return the alignmend mode (any of the ALIGN_* enumeration values).

method.name: set_text
method.description: Set the label text. Text can contain newlines.

method.name: get_text
method.description: Return the label text. Text can contain newlines.

method.name: set_autowrap
method.description: Set [html i]autowrap[html /i] mode. When enabled, autowrap will fit text to the control width, breaking sentences when they exceed the available horizontal space. When disabled, the label minimum width becomes the width of the longest row, and the minimum height large enough to fit all rows.

method.name: has_autowrap
method.description: Return the state of the [html i]autowrap[html /i] mode (see [method set_autowrap]).

constants.constant: Align rows centered.
Align rows to the left (default).
Align rows to the right (default).
Expand row whitespaces to fit the width.

class.name: Light
class.brief_description: Provides a base class for different kinds of light nodes.
class.description: Light is the abstract base class for light nodes, so it shouldn't be used directly (It can't be instanced). Other types of light nodes inherit from it. Light contains the common variables and parameters used for lighting.

class.name: LineEdit
class.brief_description: Control that provides single line string editing.
class.description: LineEdit provides a single line string editor, used for text fields.

method.name: clear
method.description: Clear the [LineEdit] text.

method.name: select_all
method.description: Select the whole string.

method.name: set_text
method.description: Set the text in the [LineEdit], clearing the existing one and the selection.

method.name: get_text
method.description: Return the text in the [LineEdit].

method.name: set_cursor_pos
method.description: Set the cursor position inside the [LineEdit], causing it to scroll if needed.

method.name: get_cursor_pos
method.description: Return the cursor position inside the [LineEdit].

method.name: set_max_length
method.description: Set the maximum amount of characters the [LineEdit] can edit, and cropping existing text in case it exceeds that limit. Setting 0 removes the limit.

method.name: get_max_length
method.description: Return the maximum amount of characters the [LineEdit] can edit. If 0 is returned, no limit exists.

method.name: append_at_cursor
method.description: Append text at cursor, scrolling the [LineEdit] when needed.

method.name: set_editable
method.description: Set the [html i]editable[html /i] status of the [LineEdit]. When disabled, existing text can't be modified and new text can't be added.

method.name: is_editable
method.description: Return the [html i]editable[html /i] status of the [LineEdit] (see [method set_editable]).

method.name: set_secret
method.description: Set the [html i]secret[html /i] status of the [LineEdit]. When enabled, every character is displayed as "*".

method.name: is_secret
method.description: Return the [html i]secret[html /i] status of the [LineEdit] (see [method set_secret]).

signal.name: text_entered
signal.description: This signal is emitted when the user presses KEY_ENTER on the [LineEdit]. This signal is often used as an alternate confirmation mechanism in dialogs.

signal.name: text_changed
signal.description: When the text changes, this signal is emitted.

class.name: MainLoop
class.brief_description: Main loop is the abstract main loop base class.
class.description: Main loop is the abstract main loop base class. All other main loop classes are derived from it. Upon application start, a [MainLoop] has to be provided to OS, else the application will exit. This happens automatically (and a [SceneMainLoop] is created), unless a main [Script] is supplied, which may or not create and return a [MainLoop].

class.name: Material
class.brief_description: Abstract base [Resource] for coloring and shading geometry.
class.description: Material is a base [Resource] used for coloring and shading geometry. All materials inherit from it and almost all [VisualInstance] derived nodes carry a Material. A few flags and parameters are shared between all material types and are configured here.

method.name: set_flag
method.description: Set a [Material] flag, which toggles on or off a behavior when rendering. See enumeration FLAG_* for a list.

method.name: get_flag
method.description: Return a [Material] flag, which toggles on or off a behavior when rendering. See enumeration FLAG_* for a list.

method.name: set_blend_mode
method.description: Set blend mode for the material, which can be one of BLEND_MODE_MIX (default), BLEND_MODE_ADD, BLEND_MODE_SUB. Keep in mind that only BLEND_MODE_MIX ensures that the material [html i]may[html /i] be opaque, any other blend mode will render with alpha blending enabled in raster-based [VisualServer] implementations.

method.name: get_blend_mode
method.description: Return blend mode for the material, which can be one of BLEND_MODE_MIX (default), BLEND_MODE_ADD, BLEND_MODE_SUB. Keep in mind that only BLEND_MODE_MIX ensures that the material [html i]may[html /i] be opaque, any other blend mode will render with alpha blending enabled in raster-based [VisualServer] implementations.

method.name: set_line_width
method.description: Set the line width for geometry drawn with FLAG_WIREFRAME enabled, or LINE primitives. Note that not all hardware or VisualServer backends support this (like DirectX).

method.name: get_line_width
method.description: Return the line width for geometry drawn with FLAG_WIREFRAME enabled, or LINE primitives. Note that not all hardware or VisualServer backends support this (like DirectX).

constants.constant: Triangle geometry is drawn as lines if this flag is enabled.
Both front facing and back facing triangles are rendered when this flag is enabled.
Geometry world transform is computed as billboard if this flag is enabled, often used for impostors.
Shading (lighting) is disabled when this flag is enabled.
Use the regular alpha blending equation (source and dest colors are faded) (default).
Maximum amount of flags
Geometry is visible when this flag is enabled (default).
Use additive blending equation, often used for particle effects such as fire or light decals.
Use substractive blending equation, often used for some smoke effects or types of glass.
Front facing and back facing order is swapped when this flag is enabled.

class.name: MenuButton
class.brief_description: Special button that brings up a [PopupMenu] when clicked.
class.description: Special button that brings up a [PopupMenu] when clicked. That's pretty much all it does, as it's just a helper class when bulding GUIs.

method.name: get_popup
method.description: Return the [PopupMenu] contained in this button.

class.name: Mesh
class.brief_description: A [Resource] that contains vertex-array based geometry.
class.description: Mesh is a type of [Resource] that contains vertex-array based geometry, divided in [html i]surfaces[html /i]. Each surface contains a completely separate array and a material used to draw it. Design wise, a mesh with multiple surfaces is prefered to a single surface, because objects created in 3D editing software commonly contain multiple materials.

method.name: add_surface
method.description: Create a new surface ([method get_surface_count] will become surf_idx for this.[html br/] Surfaces are created to be rendered using a "primitive", which may be PRIMITIVE_POINTS, PRIMITIVE_LINES, PRIMITIVE_LINE_STRIP, PRIMITIVE_LINE_LOOP, PRIMITIVE_TRIANGLES, PRIMITIVE_TRIANGLE_STRIP, PRIMITIVE_TRIANGLE_FAN. (As a note, when using indices, it is recommended to only use just points, lines or triangles).[html br/] The format of a surface determines which arrays it will allocate and hold, so "format" is a combination of ARRAY_FORMAT_* mask constants ORed together. ARRAY_FORMAT_VERTEX must be always present. "array_len" determines the amount of vertices in the array (not primitives!). if ARRAY_FORMAT_INDEX is in the format mask, then it means that an index array will be allocated and "index_array_len" must be passed.

method.name: get_surface_count
method.description: Return the amount of surfaces that the [Mesh] holds.

method.name: surface_remove
method.description: Remove a surface at position surf_idx, shifting greater surfaces one surf_idx slot down.

method.name: surface_set_array
method.description: Set a surface array, array must be defined in the format (see [method add_surface]), and which array being set in "data" must be indicated passing a value from the ARRAY_* enum (NOT THE ARRAY_FORMAT_ enum!!). A Mesh can't be displayed (error will be reported) if an array that is present in the format was not set.

method.name: surface_get_array
method.description: Return a surface array, array must be defined in the format (see [method add_surface]), and which array being returned must be indicated passing a value from the ARRAY_* enum (NOT THE ARRAY_FORMAT_ enum!!) (see [method add_surface]).

method.name: surface_get_array_len
method.description: Return the length in vertices of the vertex array in the requested surface (see [method add_surface]).

method.name: surface_get_array_index_len
method.description: Return the length in indices of the index array in the requested surface (see [method add_surface]).

method.name: surface_get_format
method.description: Return the format mask of the requested surface (see [method add_surface]).

method.name: surface_get_primitive_type
method.description: Return the primitive type of the requested surface (see [method add_surface]).

method.name: surface_set_material
method.description: Set a [Material] for a given surface. Surface will be rendered using this material.

method.name: surface_get_material
method.description: Return a [Material] in a given surface. Surface is rendered using this material.

constants.constant: Render array as lines (every two vertices a line is created).
Amount of weights/bone indices per vertex (always 4).
Array format will include vertices (mandatory).
Vertex array (array of [Vector3]() vertices).
Render array as points (one vertex equals one point).
Array format will include bone indices.
Array format will include a color array.
Array of bone indices, as a float array. Each element in groups of 4 floats.
Vertex array (array of [Color]() colors).
Index array will be used.
Array of integers, used as indices referencing vertices. No index can be beyond the vertex array size.
Render array as triangle strips.
Array format will include tangents
Array format will include normals
Tangent array, array of groups of 4 floats. first 3 floats determine the tangent, and the last the binormal direction as -1 or 1.
Normal array (array of [Vector3]() normals).
Render array as triangles (every three vertices a triangle is created).
Render array as line loop (like line strip, but closed).
Render array as line strip.
Array format will include bone weights.
Array format will include UVs.
Array of bone weights, as a float array. Each element in groups of 4 floats.
UV array (array of [Vector3]() UVs or float array of groups of 2 floats (u,v)).
Render array as triangle fans.
Default value used for index_array_len when no indices are present.

class.name: MeshInstance
class.brief_description: Node that instances meshes into a [Scenario].
class.description: MeshInstance is a [Node] that takes a [Mesh] resource and adds it to the current [Scenario] by creating an instance of it. This is the class most often used to get 3D geometry rendered and can be used to instance a sigle [Mesh] in many places. This allows to reuse geometry and save on resources. When a [Mesh] has to be instanced more than thousands of times at close proximity, consider using a [MultiMesh] in a [MultiMeshInstance] instead.

method.name: set_mesh
method.description: Set the [Mesh] resource for the instance.

method.name: get_mesh
method.description: Return the current [Mesh] resource for the instance.

method.name: get_aabb
method.description: Return the AABB of the mesh, in local coordinates.

method.name: create_trimesh_collision
method.description: This helper creates a [StaticBody] child [Node] using the mesh geometry as collision. It's mainly used for testing.

class.name: Misc
class.brief_description: Soon to be removed, bye bye.

class.name: MultiMesh
class.brief_description: Provides high perfomance mesh instancing.
class.description: MultiMesh provides low level mesh instancing. If the amount of [Mesh] instances needed goes from hundreds to thousands (and most need to be visible at close proximity) creating such a large amount of [MeshInstance] nodes may affect performance by using too much CPU or video memory. [html br/]For this case a MultiMesh becomes very useful, as it can draw thousands of instances with little API overhead.[html br/] As a drawback, if the instances are too far away of each other, performance may be reduced as every sigle instance will always rendered (they are spatially indexed as one, for the whole object).[html br/] Since instances may have any behavior, the AABB used for visibility must be provided by the user, or generated with [method generate_aabb].

method.name: set_mesh
method.description: Set the [Mesh] resource to be drawn in multiple instances.

method.name: get_mesh
method.description: Return the [Mesh] resource drawn as multiple instances.

method.name: set_instance_count
method.description: Set the amount of instnces that is going to be drawn. Changing this number will erase all the existing instance transform and color data.

method.name: get_instance_count
method.description: Return the amount of instnces that is going to be drawn.

method.name: set_instance_transform
method.description: Set the transform for a specific instance.

method.name: get_instance_transform
method.description: Return the transform of a specific instance.

method.name: set_instance_color
method.description: Set the color of a specific instance.

method.name: get_instance_color
method.description: Get the color of a specific instance.

method.name: set_aabb
method.description: Set the visibility AABB. If not provided, MultiMesh will not be visible.

method.name: get_aabb
method.description: Return the visibility AABB.

method.name: generate_aabb
method.description: Generate a new visibility AABB, using mesh AABB and instance transforms. Since instance information is stored in the [VisualServer], this function is VERY SLOW and must NOT be used often.

class.name: MultiMeshInstance
class.brief_description: Node that instances a [MultiMesh].
class.description: MultiMeshInstance is a [Node] that takes a [MultiMesh] resource and adds it to the current [Scenario] by creating an instance of it (yes, this is an instance of instances).

method.name: set_multimesh
method.description: Set the [MultiMesh] to be instance.

method.name: get_multimesh
method.description: Return the [MultiMesh] that is used for instancing.

class.name: Node
class.brief_description: Base class for all the "Scene" elements.
class.description: Nodes can be set as children of other nodes, resulting in a tree arrangement. Any tree of nodes is called a "Scene".[html br/] Scenes can be saved to disk, and then instanced into other scenes. This allows for very high flexibility in the architecture and data model of the projects. Scenes become "active" and part of the "Scene Tree" once they are added as children of a [RootNode].[html br/][html br/] As an illustrative example, a Scene (tree of nodes): [html div align="center"][html img src="images/scene.png"/][html /div] This scene will was edited separatedly, then is added as part of a game (by instancing it), becoming part of a "Scene Tree": [html div align="center"][html img src="images/scene_tree.png"/][html /div] In short, nodes are an effective all-in-one way to create and organize assets, gameplay and game data. When a Node is freed (deleted), it will delete all its children nodes. TODO: explain better process/signal/group call ordering

method.name: set_name
method.description: Set the name of the [Node]. Name must be unique within parent, and setting an already existing name will cause for the node to be automatically renamed.

method.name: get_name
method.description: Return the name of the [Node]. Name is be unique within parent.

method.name: add_child
method.description: Add a child [Node]. Nodes can have as many children as they want, but every child must have a unique name. Children nodes are automatically deleted when the parent node is deleted, so deleting a whole scene is performed by deleting its topmost node.

method.name: remove_child
method.description: Remove a child [Node]. Node is NOT deleted and will have to be deleted manually.

method.name: get_child_count
method.description: Return the amount of children nodes.

method.name: get_child
method.description: Return a children node by it's index (see [method get_child_count]). This method is often used for iterating all children of a node.

method.name: get_node
method.description: Fetch a node. "path" must be valid (or else error will occur) and can be either the name of a child node, a relative path (from the current node to another node), or an absolute path to a node.[html br/] Examples ofa paths are: get_node("Sword") , get_node("../Swamp/Alligator") , get_node("/MyGame"). [html br/]Note: fetching absolute paths only works when the node is inside the scene tree (see [method is_inside_tree]).

method.name: get_parent
method.description: Return the parent [Node] of the current [Node], or an empty Object if the node lacks a parent.

method.name: is_a_parent_of
method.description: Return [html i]true[html /i] if the "node" argument is a direct or indirect child of the current node, otherwise return [html i]false[html /i].

method.name: is_greater_than
method.description: Return [html i]true[html /i] if "node" occurs later in the scene hierarchy than the current node, otherwise return [html i]false[html /i].

method.name: get_path
method.description: Return the absolute path of the current node. This only works if the curent node is inside the scene tree (see [method is_inside_tree]).

method.name: get_path_to
method.description: Return the relative path from the current node to the specified node in "node" argument. Both nodes must be in the same scene, or else the function will fail.

method.name: add_to_group
method.description: Add a node to a group. Groups are helpers to name and organize group of nodes, like for example: "Enemies" "Collectables", etc. A [Node] can be in any number of groups. Nodes can be assigned a group at any time, but will not be added to it until they are inside the scene tree (see [method is_inside_tree]).

method.name: remove_from_group
method.description: Remove a node from a group.

method.name: move_child
method.description: Move a child node to a different position (order) amongst the other children. Since calls, signals, etc are performed by tree order, changing the order of chilren nodes may be useful.

method.name: raise
method.description: Move this node to the top of the array of nodes of the parent node. This is often useful on GUIs ([Control]), because their order of drawing fully depends on their order in the tree.

method.name: set_owner
method.description: Set the node owner. A node can have any other node as owner (as long as a valid parent, grandparent, etc ascending in the tree). When saving a node (using SceneSaver) all the nodes it owns will be saved with it. This allows to create complex SceneTrees, with instancing and subinstancing.

method.name: get_owner
method.description: Get the node owner (see [method set_node_owner]).

method.name: remove_and_skip
method.description: Remove a node and set all its children as childrens of the parent node (if exists). All even subscriptions that pass by the removed node will be unsubscribed.

method.name: get_index
method.description: Get the node index in the parent (assuming it has a parent).

method.name: print_tree
method.description: Print the screne to stdout. Used mainly for debugging purposes.

method.name: set_filename
method.description: A node can contain a filename. This filename should not be changed by the user, unless writing editors and tools. When a scene is instanced from a file, it topmost node contains the filename from where it was loaded.

method.name: get_filename
method.description: Return a filename that may be containedA node can contained by the node. When a scene is instanced from a file, it topmost node contains the filename from where it was loaded (see [method set_filename]).

method.name: propagate_notification
method.description: Notify the current node and all its chldren recursively by calling notification() in all of them.

method.name: set_process
method.description: Enables or disables node processing. When a node is being processed, it will receive a NOTIFICATION_PROCESS on every frame. It is common to check how much time was elapsed since the previous frame by calling [method get_process_time]. If the application is set to run at 60 fps, NOTIFICATION_PROCESS will be received 60 times per second (even if the visuals are running at faster or lower fps). Because of this, nodes that wish to do processing are recommended to use [method set_idle_process] instead, unless strong syncronization is requiered (for example, to modify the behavior of physics objects).

method.name: get_process_time
method.description: Return the amount of time elapsed (in seconds) between two succesive NOTIFICATION_PROCESS notifications.

method.name: is_processing
method.description: Return wether processing is enabled in the current node.

method.name: set_idle_process
method.description: Enables or disables node idle processing. When a node is being idle-processed, it will receive a NOTIFICATION_IDLE_PROCESS when idle. It is common to check how much time was elapsed since the previous idle time by calling [method get_idle_process_time]. Idle processing is commonly syncronized to [VisualServer] being done rendering a frame, so this type of processing is syncronized to the visible frames per second. To syncronize with the desired frames per second, see [method set_process] instead.

method.name: get_idle_process_time
method.description: Return the amount of time elapsed (in seconds) between two succesive NOTIFICATION_IDLE_PROCESS notifications.

method.name: is_idle_processing
method.description: Return wether idle processing is enabled in the current node.

method.name: duplicate
method.description: Return a duplicate of the scene, with all nodes and parameters copied. Subscriptions will not be duplicated.

method.name: replace_by
method.description: Replace a node in a scene by a given one. Subscriptions that pass through this node will be lost.

constants.constant: Notification received when a node is unparented (parent removed it from the list of children).
Notification received every frame when the process flag is set (see [method set_process]).
Notification received when a node is set as a child of another node. Note that this doesn't mean that a node entered the Scene Tree.
Notification received every time the application enters idle when the idle process flag is set (see [method set_process]).

class.name: OmniLight
class.brief_description: OmniDirectional Light, such as a lightbulb or a candle.
class.description: An OmniDirectional light is a type of [Light] node that emits lights in all directions. The light is attenuated through the distance and this attenuation can be configured by changing the energy, radius and attenuation parameters of [Light]. TODO: Image of an omnilight.

class.name: OptionButton
class.brief_description: Button control that provides selectable options when pressed.
class.description: OptionButton is a type button that provides a selectable list of items when pressed. The item selected becomes the "current" item and is displayed as the button text.

method.name: add_item
method.description: Add an item, with text "label" and (optionally) id. If no "id" is passed, "id" becomes the item index. New items are appended at the end.

method.name: add_icon_item
method.description: Add an item, with a "texture" icon, text "label" and (optionally) id. If no "id" is passed, "id" becomes the item index. New items are appended at the end.

method.name: set_item_text
method.description: Set the text of an item at index "idx".

method.name: set_item_icon
method.description: Set the icon of an item at index "idx".

method.name: set_item_ID
method.description: Set the ID of an item at index "idx".

method.name: get_item_text
method.description: Return the text of the item at index "idx".

method.name: get_item_icon
method.description: Return the icon of the item at index "idx".

method.name: get_item_ID
method.description: Return the ID of the item at index "idx".

method.name: get_item_count
method.description: Return the amount of items in the OptionButton.

method.name: add_separator
method.description: Add a separator to the list of items. Separators help to group items. Separator also takes up an index and is appended at the end.

method.name: clear
method.description: Clear all the items in the [OptionButton].

method.name: select
method.description: Select an item by index and make it the current item.

method.name: get_selected
method.description: Return the current item index

signal.name: item_selected
signal.description: This signal is emitted when the current item was changed by the user. ID of the item selected is passed as argument (if no IDs were added, ID will be just the item index).

class.name: PacketPeer
class.brief_description: Abstraction and base class for packet-based protocols.
class.description: PacketPeer is an abstration and base class for packet-based protocols (such as UDP). It provides an API for sending and receiving packets both as raw data or variables. This makes it easy to transfer data over a protocol, without having to encode data as low level bytes or having to worry about network ordering.

class.name: PacketPeerStream
class.brief_description: Wrapper to use a PacketPeer over a StreamPeer.
class.description: PacketStreamPeer provides a wrapper for working using packets over a stream. This allows for using packet based code with StreamPeers. PacketPeerStream implements a custom protocol over the StreamPeer, so the user should not read or write to the wrapped StreamPeer directly.

method.name: set_stream_peer
method.description: Set the StreamPeer object to be wrapped

class.name: Panel
class.brief_description: Provides an opaque background for [Control] children.
class.description: Panel is a [Control] that displays an opaque background. It's commoly used as a parent and container for other types of [Control] nodes. [html div align="center"][html img src="images/panel_example.png"/][html /div]

class.name: Particles
class.brief_description: Particle system 3D Node
class.description: Particles is a particle system 3D [Node] that is used to simulate several types of particle effects, such as explosions, rain, snow, fireflies, or other magical-like shinny sparkles. Particles are drawn using impostors, and given their dynamic behavior, the user must provide a visibility AABB (although helpers to create one automatically exist).

method.name: set_amount
method.description: Set total amount of particles in the system.

method.name: get_amount
method.description: Return the total amount of particles in the system.

method.name: set_emitting
method.description: Set the "emitting" property state. When emitting, the particle system generates new particles at constant rate.

method.name: is_emitting
method.description: Return the "emitting" property state (see [method set_emitting]).

method.name: set_visibility_aabb
method.description: Set the visibility AABB for the particle system, since the default one will not work properly most of the time.

method.name: get_visibility_aabb
method.description: Return the current visibility AABB.

method.name: set_emission_half_extents
method.description: Set the half extents for the emission box.

method.name: get_emission_half_extents
method.description: Return the half extents for the emission box.

method.name: set_gravity_normal
method.description: Set the normal vector towards where gravity is pulling (by default, negative Y).

method.name: get_gravity_normal
method.description: Return the normal vector towards where gravity is pulling (by default, negative Y).

method.name: set_variable
method.description: Set a specific variable for the particle system (see VAR_* enum).

method.name: get_variable
method.description: Return a specific variable for the particle system (see VAR_* enum).

method.name: set_randomness
method.description: Set the randomness for a specific variable of the particle system. Randomness produces small changes from the default each time a particle is emitted.

method.name: get_randomness
method.description: Return the randomness for a specific variable of the particle system. Randomness produces small changes from the default each time a particle is emitted.

method.name: set_color_phase_pos
method.description: Set the position of a color phase (0 to 1)

method.name: get_color_phase_pos
method.description: Return the position of a color phase (0 to 1)

method.name: set_color_phase_color
method.description: Set the color of a color phase.

method.name: get_color_phase_color
method.description: Return the color of a color phase.

method.name: set_material
method.description: Set the material used to draw particles

method.name: get_material
method.description: Return the material used to draw particles

class.name: PhysicsBody
class.brief_description: Base class for differnt types of Physics bodies.
class.description: PhysicsBody is an abstract base class for implementing a physics body. All PhysicsBody types inherit from it.

class.name: Popup
class.brief_description: Base container control for popups and dialogs.
class.description: PopUp is a base [Control] used to show dialogs and popups. It's a subwindow and modal by default (see [Control]) and has helpers for custom popup behavior.

method.name: popup_centered
method.description: Popup (show the control in modal form) in the center of the screen, at the curent size, or at a size determined by "size".

method.name: popup_centered_ratio
method.description: Popup (show the control in modal form) in the center of the screen, scalled at a ratio of size of the screen.

method.name: popup
method.description: Popup (show the control in modal form).

signal.name: about_to_show
signal.description: This signal is emitted when a popup is about to be shown. (often used in [PopupMenu] for clearing the list of options and creating a new one according to the current context).

class.name: PopupMenu
class.brief_description: PopupMenu displays a list of options.
class.description: PopupMenu is the typical Control that displays a list of options. They are popular in toolbars or context menus.

method.name: add_icon_item
method.description: Add a new item with text "label" and icon "texture. An id can optonally be provided, as well as an accelerator. If no id is provided, one will be created from the index.

method.name: add_item
method.description: Add a new item with text "label". An id can optonally be provided, as well as an accelerator. If no id is provided, one will be created from the index.

method.name: add_icon_check_item
method.description: Add a new checkable item with text "label" and icon "texture. An id can optonally be provided, as well as an accelerator. If no id is provided, one will be created from the index. Note that checkable items just display a checkmark, but don't have any built-in checking behavior and must be checked/unchecked manually.

method.name: add_check_item
method.description: Add a new checkable item with text "label". An id can optonally be provided, as well as an accelerator. If no id is provided, one will be created from the index. Note that checkable items just display a checkmark, but don't have any built-in checking behavior and must be checked/unchecked manually.

method.name: set_item_text
method.description: Set the text of the item at index "idx".

method.name: set_item_icon
method.description: Set the icon of the item at index "idx".

method.name: set_item_accelerator
method.description: Set the accelerator of the item at index "idx". Accelerators are special combinations of keys that activate the item, no matter which control is fucused.

method.name: set_item_checked
method.description: Set the checkstate status of the item at index "idx".

method.name: set_item_ID
method.description: Set the id of the item at index "idx".

method.name: get_item_text
method.description: Return the text of the item at index "idx".

method.name: get_item_icon
method.description: Return the icon of the item at index "idx".

method.name: get_item_accelerator
method.description: Return the accelerator of the item at index "idx". Accelerators are special combinations of keys that activate the item, no matter which control is fucused.

method.name: is_item_checked
method.description: Return the checkstate status of the item at index "idx".

method.name: get_item_ID
method.description: Return the id of the item at index "idx".

method.name: get_item_index
method.description: Find and return the index of the item containing a given id.

method.name: get_item_count
method.description: Return the amount of items.

method.name: add_separator
method.description: Add a separator between items. Separators also occupy an index.

method.name: clear
method.description: Clear the popup menu.

signal.name: item_pressed
signal.description: This even is emitted when an item is pressed or its accelerator is activated. The id of the item is returned if it exists, else the index.

class.name: Portal
class.brief_description: Portals provide virtual openings to rooms.
class.description: Portals provide virtual openings to [RoomInstance] nodes, so cameras can look at them from the outside. Note that portals are a visibility optimization technique, and are in no way related to the game of the same name (as in, they are not used for teleportation). For more information on how rooms and portals work, see [RoomInstance]. Portals are represented as 2D convex polygon shapes (in the X,Y local plane), and are placed on the surface of the areas occupied by a [RoomInstance], to indicate that the room can be accessed or looked-at through them. If two rooms are next to each other, and two similar portals in each of them share the same world position (and are parallel and opposed to each other), they will automatically "connect" and form "doors" (for example, the portals that connect a kitchen to a living room are placed in the door they share). Portals must always have a [RoomInstance] node as a parent, grandparent or far parent, or else they will not be active.

method.name: set_shape
method.description: Set the portal shape. The shape is an array of [Point2] points, representing a convex polygon in the X,Y plane.

method.name: get_shape
method.description: Return the portal shape. The shape is an array of [Point2] points, representing a convex polygon in the X,Y plane.

method.name: set_enabled
method.description: Enable the portal (it is enabled by defaul though), disabling it will cause the parent [RoomInstance] to not be visible any longer when looking through the portal.

method.name: is_enabled
method.description: Return wether the portal is active. When disabled it causes the parent [RoomInstance] to not be visible any longer when looking through the portal.

method.name: set_disable_distance
method.description: Set the distance threshold for disabling the portal. Every time that the portal goes beyond "distance", it disables itself, becoming the opaque color (see [method set_disabled_color]).

method.name: get_disable_distance
method.description: Return the distance threshold for disabling the portal. Every time that the portal goes beyond "distance", it disables itself, becoming the opaque color (see [method set_disabled_color]).

method.name: set_disabled_color
method.description: When the portal goes beyond the disable distance (see [method set_disable_distance]), it becomes opaque and displayed with color "color".

method.name: get_disabled_color
method.description: Return the color for when the portal goes beyond the disable distance (see [method set_disable_distance]) and becomes disabled.

method.name: set_connect_range
method.description: Set the range for auto-connecting two portals from different rooms sharing the same space.

method.name: get_connect_range
method.description: Return the range for auto-connecting two portals from different rooms sharing the same space.

class.name: Range
class.brief_description: Abstract base class for range-based controls.
class.description: Range is a base class for [Control] nodes that change a floating point [html i]value[html /i] between a need a [html i]minimum[html /i], [html i]maximum[html /i], using [html i]step[html /i] and [html i]page[html /i], for example a [ScrollBar].

method.name: get_val
method.description: Return the current value.

method.name: get_min
method.description: Return the minimum value.

method.name: get_max
method.description: Return the maximum value.

method.name: get_step
method.description: Return the stepping, if step is 0, stepping is disabled.

method.name: get_page
method.description: Return the page size, if page is 0, paging is disabled.

method.name: get_unit_value
method.description: Return value mapped to 0 to 1 (unit) range.

method.name: set_min
method.description: Set minimum value, clamped range value to it if it's less.

method.name: set_step
method.description: Set step value. If step is 0, stepping will be disabled.

method.name: set_page
method.description: Set page size. Page is mainly used for scrollbars or anything that controls text scrolling.

method.name: set_unit_value
method.description: Set value mapped to 0 to 1 (unit) range, it will then be converted to the actual value within min and max.

signal.name: value_changed
signal.description: This signal is emitted when value changes.

signal.name: changed
signal.description: This signal is emitted when min, max, range or step change.

class.name: Resource
class.brief_description: Base class for all resources.
class.description: Resource is the base class for all resource types. Resources are primarily data containers. They are reference counted and freed when no longer in use. They are also loaded only once from disk, and further attempts to load the resource will return the same reference (all this in contrast to a [Node], which is not reference counted and can be instanced from disk as many times as desred). Resources can be saved externally on disk or bundled into another object, such as a [Node] or another resource.

method.name: set_path
method.description: Set the path of the resource. This is useful mainly for editors when saving/loading, and shouldn't be changed by anything else.

method.name: get_path
method.description: Return the path of the resource. This is useful mainly for editors when saving/loading, and shouldn't be changed by anything else.

method.name: set_name
method.description: Set the name of the resources, any name is ok (it doesn't have to be unique). Name is for descriptive purposes only.

method.name: get_name
method.description: Return the name of the resources, any name is ok (it doesn't have to be unique). Name is for descriptive purposes only.

method.name: get_rid
method.description: Return the RID of the resource (or an empty RID). Many resources (such as [Texture], [Mesh], etc) are high level abstractions of resources stored in a server, so this function will return the original RID.

class.name: Room
class.brief_description: Room data resource.
class.description: Room contains the data to define the bounds of a scene (using a BSP Tree). It is instanced by a [RoomInstance] node to create rooms. See that class documentation for more information about rooms.

method.name: set_bounds
method.description: Set the bounds of the room as a BSP tree. a BSP Tree is defined a Dictionary: (TODO - see source code on how to create a BSP tree from a dictionary).

method.name: get_bounds
method.description: Return the bounds of the room as a BSP tree. a BSP Tree is defined a Dictionary: (TODO - see source code on how to create a BSP tree from a dictionary).

method.name: set_geometry_hint
method.description: Set the "geometry" hint of the room. This means, how the room actually looks (an array of [Vector3]s, forming triangles).

method.name: get_geometry_hint
method.description: Return the "geometry" hint of the room. This means, how the room actually looks (an array of [Vector3]s, forming triangles).

class.name: RoomInstance
class.brief_description: Node that instances a Room.
class.description: RoomInstance is a [Node] that instances a [Room] resource and places it on the world. Rooms are used for defining the areas taken up by [html i]interiors[html /i]. An [html i]interior[html /i] is any closed space that has an entrance/exit (or not) to the outside world, for example the inside of a house, a room in a house, a cave.[html br/]So why is this used? Rooms and Portals ([Portal]) are a common visualization optimization technique, it is used to make interiors invisible (not rendered) when the camera is at the exterior (such as an open field), and also the exterior invisible when inside an interior (such as a house). It is also used to make interior rooms invisible from other interior rooms. [html div align="center"][html img src="images/portals_example.png"/][html /div]

method.name: set_room
method.description: Set the [Room] resource, containing the room bounds.

method.name: get_room
method.description: Return the [Room] resource, containing the room bounds.

method.name: compute_room_from_subtree
method.description: This helper function computes a [Room] from the shapes of all the children [VisualInstance] nodes, and sets it to the node.

class.name: Sample
class.brief_description: Audio Sample (sound) class.
class.description: Sample provides an audio sample class, containing audio data, together with some information for playback, such as format, mix rate and loop. It is used by sound playback routines.

method.name: create
method.description: Create new data for the sample, with format "format" (see FORMAT_* enum), stereo hint, and length in frames (not samples or bytes!) "frame". Calling create overrides previous existing data if it exists. Stereo samples are interleaved pairs of left and right (in that order) points

method.name: get_format
method.description: Return the sample format (see FORMAT_* enum).

method.name: is_stereo
method.description: Return true if the sample was created stereo.

method.name: get_length
method.description: Return the sample length in frames.

method.name: set_data
method.description: Set sample data. Data must be little endian, no matter the host platform, and exactly as long to fit all frames. Example, if data is Stereo, 16 bits, 256 frames, it will be 1024 bytes long.

method.name: get_data
method.description: Return sample data. Data will be endian, no matter with the host platform, and exactly as long to fit all frames. Example, if data is Stereo, 16 bits, 256 frames, it will be 1024 bytes long.

method.name: set_mix_rate
method.description: Set the mix rate for the sample (expected playback frequency).

method.name: get_mix_rate
method.description: Return the mix rate for the sample (expected playback frequency).

method.name: set_loop_format
method.description: Set the loop format, see LOOP_* enum

method.name: get_loop_format
method.description: Return the loop format, see LOOP_* enum.

method.name: set_loop_begin
method.description: Set the loop begin position, it must be a valid frame and less than the loop end position.

method.name: get_loop_begin
method.description: Return the loop begin position.

method.name: set_loop_end
method.description: Set the loop end position, it must be a valid frame and greater than the loop begin position.

method.name: get_loop_end
method.description: Return the loop begin position.

constants.constant: Ima-ADPCM Audio.
Forward looping (when playback reaches loop end, goes back to loop begin)
16-Bits signed little endian PCM audio.
8-Bits signed little endian PCM audio.
No loop enabled.
Ping-Pong looping (when playback reaches loop end, plays backward untilloop begin). Not available in all platforms.

class.name: SamplePlayer
class.brief_description: Sample Player node.
class.description: SamplePlayer is a [Node] meant for simple sample playback. A library of samples is loaded and played back "as is", without positioning or anything.

method.name: set_voice_count
method.description: Set the amount of simultaneous voices that will be used for playback.

method.name: get_voice_count
method.description: Return the amount of simultaneous voices that will be used for playback.

method.name: play
method.description: Play back sample, given it's identifier "name". if "unique" is true, all othere previous samples will be stopped. The voice allocated for playback will be returned.

method.name: stop
method.description: Stop a voice "voice". (see [method play]).

method.name: set_mix_rate
method.description: Change the mix rate of a voice "voice" to given "hz".

method.name: set_pitch_scale
method.description: Scale the pitch (mix rate) of a voice by a ratio value "ratio". A ratio of 1.0 means the voice is unscaled.

method.name: set_volume
method.description: Set the volume of a voice, 0db is maximum volume (every about -6db, volume is reduced in half). "db" does in fact go from zero to negative.

method.name: set_pan
method.description: Set the panning of a voice. Panning goes from -1 (left) to +1 (right). Optionally, if the hardware supports 3D sound, also set depth and height (also in range -1 to +1).

method.name: set_filter
method.description: Set and enable a filter of a voice, with type "type" (see FILTER_* enum), cutoff (0 to 22khz) frequency and resonance (0+).

method.name: set_chorus
method.description: Set the chorus send level of a voice (0 to 1). For setting chorus parameters, see [AudioServer].

method.name: set_reverb
method.description: Set the reverb send level and type of a voice (0 to 1). (see REVERB_* enum for type).

method.name: get_mix_rate
method.description: Return the current mix rate for a given voice.

method.name: get_pitch_scale
method.description: Return the current pitch scale for a given voice.

method.name: get_volume
method.description: Return the current volume (in db) for a given voice. 0db is maximum volume (every about -6db, volume is reduced in half). "db" does in fact go from zero to negative.

method.name: get_pan
method.description: Return the current panning for a given voice. Panning goes from -1 (left) to +1 (right).

method.name: get_pan_depth
method.description: Return the current pan depth for a given voice (not used unless the hardware supports 3D sound)

method.name: get_pan_height
method.description: Return the current pan height for a given voice (not used unless the hardware supports 3D sound)

method.name: get_filter_type
method.description: Return the current filter type in use (see FILTER_* enum) for a given voice.

method.name: get_filter_cutoff
method.description: Return the current filter cutoff for a given voice. Cutoff goes from 0 to 22khz.

method.name: get_filter_resonance
method.description: Return the current filter resonance for a given voice. Resonance goes from 0 up.

method.name: get_chorus
